1.speaker: PENGUIN
1.character: ナマケモノくん 前にも面接来たけど
1.definition: You came here for an interview before,

2.character: 採用にならなかったじゃない

3.speaker: SLOTH
3.definition: I would like to live in...

5.speaker: SLOTH
5.character: あれは～ 面接にきたわけじゃ…
5.definition: I didn't... actually come for an interview...

7.speaker: SLOTH
7.character: 改めて～ お願いします～
7.definition: With that being said... could I get an interview?

10.speaker: PANDA
10.character: じゃあ 笹子さんは クビだね
10.definition: That would mean you're fired, Miss Sasako.

12.speaker: POLAR BEAR
12.character: もう１人くらい バイトがいてもいいよ
12.definition: I wouldn't mind having another part-timer.

13.speaker: POLAR BEAR
13.character: 僕が 休みやすくなるから
13.definition: I could take more breaks that way.

14.speaker: PANDA
14.character: シロクマくんが ナマケモノになっちゃうね
14.definition: Then you'll become a sloth, Polar Bear.

15.speaker: POLAR BEAR
15.character: ナマケモノカフェだね

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.character: やる気なさそうなカフェだな～
16.definition: Sounds like a rather lazy café.

17.speaker: POLAR BEAR
17.character: じゃ 面接を始めようか
17.definition: Well then, let's begin the interview.

18.speaker: SLOTH
18.definition: Here's my résumé... You actually made one.

19.speaker: POLAR BEAR
19.character: どのくらい かかったの?
19.definition: How long did it take you?

21.speaker: PENGUIN
21.character: この時点で 不採用じゃないのかな…
21.definition: I think we could stop this interview right now.

22.speaker: SASAKO
22.character: せっかくなので履歴書の中身も 見てあげてください
22.definition: Since he worked so hard on it, please at least look at the résumé. What?!

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.character: ナマケモノくん 大学 行ってたの!?

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.character: 大学院まで出てるんだ…
24.definition: And you even went to graduate school...

25.speaker: POLAR BEAR
25.definition: That's a pretty high level of academic achievement.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.character: ナマケモノくんの大学生活って どんなふうだったの?
26.definition: So what was college life like for you, Sloth?

27.speaker: SLOTH
27.character: ずっと 木の上でした～
27.definition: I was always on top of a tree...

28.speaker: PENGUIN
28.character: よく 卒業できたね
28.definition: I'm surprised you were able to graduate...

29.speaker: POLAR BEAR
29.character: 特技は 樹上生活研究
29.definition: Your skills... "Research of being up in a tree."

30.speaker: SLOTH
30.character: 一生の ほとんど 木の上で ジッとしてます
30.definition: I've spent nearly all of my life... living up in a tree, barely moving...

31.speaker: PENGUIN
31.definition: I wonder if you can call that a skill...

32.speaker: POLAR BEAR
32.character: 趣味は 社交ダンス
32.definition: Your hobbies are... "Ballroom dancing." I don't think you can do that up in a tree.

33.speaker: POLAR BEAR
33.character: 他にアピールすることないかな?
33.definition: Do you have any other traits that may be appealing?

34.speaker: SLOTH
34.definition: I do... when I get older...

35.speaker: SLOTH
35.character: 体にコケが～ 生えます～

38.speaker: POLAR BEAR
38.character: おもしろそうだから 明日から来なよ
38.definition: Because this could be fun. You can start tomorrow.

39.speaker: SASAKO
39.character: よかったですね ナマケモノさん
39.definition: Congratulations, Mr. Sloth. I'll do my best...

40.speaker: PENGUIN
40.definition: I wonder if he'll be okay.

41.speaker: SASAKO
41.character: ナマケモノさん 来ませんね～
41.definition: Mr. Sloth hasn't shown up yet...

42.speaker: SASAKO
42.character: やっぱり 様子見にいきましょうか?
42.definition: Maybe we should go check on him?

43.speaker: POLAR BEAR
43.definition: I'm sure he'll be here eventually. Good morning...

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.character: よく来たね なんか 感動した!
45.definition: You actually made it. I'm sort of moved.

46.speaker: POLAR BEAR
46.character: どれくらい前に 出てきたの?
46.definition: How long ago did you leave your place? Twelve hours ago...

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.definition: You literally spent half a day getting here?!

51.speaker: POLAR BEAR
51.definition: Yes, ma'am. All right, Sloth. Please go take her order.

53.speaker: PENGUIN
53.character: あそこまで どのくらいかかるの?
53.definition: How long will it take you to get over there?

55.speaker: PANDA
55.character: お客さん帰っちゃうね

56.speaker: SASAKO
56.character: あの… 私 行ってきますね
56.definition: Um, I'll go take her order.

57.speaker: POLAR BEAR
57.character: じゃあ テーブル拭いてくれるかな?
57.definition: Will you wipe off the tables, then?

59.speaker: PENGUIN
59.character: かれこれ… ２時間は拭いてるね
59.definition: He's been cleaning that table for about two hours.

61.speaker: PENGUIN
61.character: パンダくんも ちょっと見習ったら?
61.definition: You should learn from him, Panda.

62.speaker: PANDA
62.character: ナマケモノくんを見てると
62.definition: Watching Sloth is like being told that we can't hurry life.

63.speaker: PENGUIN
63.character: キミは自分に 都合よく考える天才だね
63.definition: You're an absolute genius when it comes to twisting thoughts to suit you.

64.speaker: POLAR BEAR
64.character: ナマケモノくん 次はコップ拭いてくれる?
64.definition: Could you wipe off some cups next, Sloth? Okay...

65.speaker: PANDA
65.character: 終わったのは ３時間かけて１個だけだね
65.definition: So he's finally done with one cup after three hours.

66.speaker: PENGUIN
66.character: なんだか… 悠久って言葉を思い出したよ

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.definition: Eternity {\i1}(yukyu){\i0}? That would be a pitch {\i1}(toukyu){\i0}. That would be table tennis {\i1}(takkyu){\i0}. Those would be deep breaths {\i1}(shinkokyu){\i0}.

69.speaker: PENGUIN
69.character: 果てしなく長いってことだよ
69.definition: It means a long time that never ends. He's asleep...

70.speaker: POLAR BEAR
70.character: 活動限界が来たようだね
70.definition: I believe he's used up his energy.

72.speaker: POLAR BEAR
72.character: 笹子さんが 謝ることはないよ
72.definition: You don't need to apologize, Miss Sasako.

73.speaker: PENGUIN
73.character: 夜明け前に出発したっぽいから しかたないよね
73.definition: Well, he did leave his place before dawn, so I guess it can't be helped.

74.speaker: PANDA
74.character: また あんなに新聞たまってるよ?
74.definition: His newspapers are piling up again. Well, he said he only goes home once a week. He should probably just stop getting the paper...

75.speaker: SASAKO
75.character: 折り込み広告を見るのが 好きなんですって
75.definition: He apparently likes to read the ad inserts.

76.speaker: POLAR BEAR
76.character: ナマケモノくんが広告見る頃には
76.definition: By the time Sloth looks at the advertisements,

77.speaker: POLAR BEAR
77.character: もうその特売 終わってるんじゃない?
77.definition: I think the sales would be over.

78.speaker: SASAKO
78.definition: Yes, that's true... Wow. It's pretty tidy.

79.speaker: POLAR BEAR
79.character: 笹子さん 時々来て 掃除してるみたいだしね
79.definition: Miss Sasako comes by sometimes to tidy up the place.

81.speaker: PANDA
81.definition: You're such a hard worker, Miss Sasako.

82.speaker: POLAR BEAR
82.character: そういえば時々買い物や散歩にも連れていってあげてるよね
82.definition: Now that I think about it, you sometimes take him shopping and on walks, too, don't you?

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.definition: Sounds like a lot of trouble.

86.speaker: PANDA
86.character: 僕も連れてってよ 竹につかまるから～
86.definition: You should take me, too. I'll just hold on to some bamboo.

87.speaker: PENGUIN
87.character: パンダくんは重いから無理でしょ?
87.definition: You're awfully heavy, so I doubt that'll work. I'm sure it'll be fine.

88.speaker: PENGUIN
88.character: いつも思うけど キミのその自信はどこから来るんだろうね
88.definition: I've always wondered something... Where does your self-confidence come from? Huh? My house... Are you awake?

89.speaker: SASAKO
89.character: シロクマさんが運んでくれたんですよ
89.definition: Mr. Polar Bear carried you here. So I'm fired...

90.speaker: POLAR BEAR
90.character: いや また明日来なよ
90.definition: Nope. You can come again tomorrow.

92.speaker: PANDA
92.character: ナマケモノくん どうして そんなに働きたいの?
92.definition: Why do you want to work so badly, Sloth?

93.speaker: SLOTH
93.definition: I want to treat... Miss Sasako to dinner...

95.speaker: SLOTH
95.character: いつもお世話になってるのに 何もできなくて～
95.definition: She's always helping me out... And I can't do anything for her...

96.speaker: SLOTH
96.character: たまには ガンバリモノに ならなくっちゃって…
96.definition: So I figured... I needed to be a hard worker at times...

97.speaker: SASAKO
97.character: 気にしないでください
97.definition: Please don't worry about it. I actually want to thank you.

99.speaker: SASAKO
99.character: 私が今 こうやって しろくまカフェで 働くことになったのも
99.definition: The reason I even got to work at Polar Bear's Café

100.speaker: SASAKO
100.character: もともとは ナマケモノさんのおかげですし
100.definition: is actually because of you, Mr. Sloth.

101.speaker: POLAR BEAR
101.character: そうだね ナマケモノくんのおかげだね
101.definition: That's true. It is because of you, Sloth.

102.speaker: SLOTH
102.definition: Mr. Polar Bear... Not to mention, I feel very relaxed when I'm with you, Mr. Sloth.

103.speaker: SASAKO
103.character: だから… 私のほうこそ お礼を言わせてください
103.definition: So please, allow me to thank you.

105.speaker: SLOTH
105.character: じゃあ 働かないよ～
105.definition: Then I won't work... I'll continue being a sloth...

107.speaker: PANDA
107.character: じゃあ 僕も ゴロゴロしたままでいるよ～
107.definition: Then I'll continue lazing around, too.

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.character: キミは もうちょっと… 頑張りなよ
108.definition: I think you should actually try working a little harder.

109.speaker: POLAR BEAR
109.character: 笹子さんへの クリスマスプレゼント?
109.definition: A Christmas present for Miss Sasako? I know it's a little early,

110.definition: but what should I get her? Well...

111.speaker: POLAR BEAR
111.character: 笹子さんに何が欲しいか聞こう
111.definition: Let's ask Miss Sasako what she wants.

112.speaker: HANDA
112.character: え… なんて聞くつもり?
112.definition: Huh? What are you going to ask her? I'll tell her, "Mr. Handa wants to get you a Christmas present.

114.speaker: HANDA
114.character: それじゃ 直接的すぎるよ!

115.speaker: HANDA
115.character: もっと こう… 遠まわしに聞いてくれる?
115.definition: Couldn't you be a little more subtle?

117.speaker: POLAR BEAR
117.character: 笹子さんに好意を寄せてる 動物園に勤務してる人が
117.definition: "What gift could a person working at the zoo, who has feelings for you,

118.character: そんなに負担にならずに 買えるくらいのもので
118.definition: get for you without being too much of a burden?"

120.speaker: HANDA
120.character: それも全部 言っちゃってるよ!
120.definition: You're telling her everything with that statement, too!

122.speaker: HANDA
122.character: もっと さりげなく聞いてよ
122.definition: Ask her much more nonchalantly, please...

125.speaker: POLAR BEAR
125.character: ううん 半田さんが僕に注文してるの
125.definition: No. Mr. Handa is giving me an order.

126.speaker: POLAR BEAR
126.character: 笹子さんが クリスマスに何が欲しいか さりげなく聞いてくれって
126.definition: He's asking me to nonchalantly ask Miss Sasako what she would like for Christmas.

127.speaker: LESSER
127.character: さりげなく… ですか

128.speaker: POLAR BEAR
128.definition: Rather hard, isn't it? Well, is there something you'd like, Mr. Handa?

129.speaker: HANDA
129.character: 掃除機が壊れちゃったから 新しいのが欲しいかな…
129.definition: My vacuum broke, so I was thinking I might like a new one. Then let's get her a vacuum.

130.speaker: HANDA
130.character: いや それ 僕の欲しいものだし…

131.speaker: POLAR BEAR
131.character: じゃあ… ベンチプレスや ローラーはどう?
131.definition: Then... How about a bench press set or rollers? Those are things you want, aren't they?

132.speaker: LESSER
132.character: 調査してみては どうでしょう?
132.definition: Why not gather a little intel? How?

137.speaker: PANDA
137.definition: I'll answer, too! You don't have to, Panda.

139.speaker: POLAR BEAR
139.character: 笹子さんじゃないから

141.speaker: POLAR BEAR
141.character: このアンケートは 回答者が 笹子さんなのが重要なんだよ
141.definition: It's important that the person answering this questionnaire is Miss Sasako.

142.speaker: SASAKO
142.definition: It is? Seriously, what is this? A questionnaire only for Miss Sasako?

143.speaker: POLAR BEAR
143.character: 人間の女性消費者の 好みと傾向を調査するんだよ
143.definition: It's to find out the interests of young female humans.

146.speaker: SASAKO
146.character: 好きな色は 何ですか?

148.speaker: PENGUIN
148.character: いや パンダくんはいいから

149.speaker: PANDA
149.definition: Really? Did you listen to a word we said?

151.speaker: SASAKO
151.character: そうですね… 特別に好きな色ってないですね
151.definition: Let's see... I don't think I really have a favorite color.

152.speaker: POLAR BEAR
152.definition: Doesn't really have one... Okay, next?

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.character: えっと…趣味は何ですか?

154.speaker: PANDA
154.character: パンダグッズ集めだよ

155.speaker: PENGUIN
155.character: だから… パンダくんはいいんだよ?
155.definition: Like I said, she's not asking you, Panda.

156.speaker: PANDA
156.character: じゃあ ペンギンさんの つまんない趣味はなに?
156.definition: Then what's your boring hobby, Mr. Penguin?

158.character: というか 笹子さんの答えを聞こう
158.definition: More importantly, let's hear Miss Sasako's answer.

159.speaker: SASAKO
159.character: 趣味というほどのものは…
159.definition: I don't have anything that'd be considered a hobby... Doesn't really have one... Okay, next?

160.speaker: SASAKO
160.character: え～と… 最近 ハマっていることは?
160.definition: Um, what is your latest obsession?

161.speaker: SASAKO
161.character: ダンゴムシを触ることですね

162.speaker: PENGUIN
162.definition: What the heck? It's an app on my phone. I'm currently obsessed with a game where you see how many of them

163.character: っていうゲームに ハマってるんです
163.definition: you can touch within a given time.

164.speaker: PENGUIN
164.character: なんか 年頃の女子にしては 珍しいね
164.definition: Sounds rather unusual for a girl your age.

165.speaker: SASAKO
165.definition: You think so? You're sure a toughie, Miss Sasako.

166.speaker: LESSER
166.character: せっかく アンケート作ったのに
166.definition: It's a shame that the questionnaire we made didn't work out.

167.speaker: POLAR BEAR
167.definition: Indeed. Next we'll have a ladies gathering.

169.speaker: LESSER
169.definition: So, that's what's going on. All right.

170.speaker: PANDA MAMA
170.character: 笹子さんの欲しいものや好みを聞き出せばいいのね?
170.definition: So we just have to find out what Miss Sasako wants and her interests, right?

171.speaker: LESSER
171.character: よろしくお願いします!

173.speaker: SASAKO
173.character: いいんですか? 私も参加させていただいて
173.definition: Are you sure it's all right that I join you? Of course!

174.speaker: MAMA RS
174.character: 今日はおしゃべり楽しみましょ

176.speaker: PANDA MAMA
176.character: ほら 寒くなってきたでしょ?

177.speaker: PANDA MAMA
177.character: そろそろ 耳あてが欲しいのよね
177.definition: I've been thinking about buying earmuffs. But it's hard to find a pair that will fit pandas.

178.speaker: MAMA RS
178.character: 私は 手袋が欲しいのよ

179.speaker: MAMA RS
179.character: 売ってるのはみんな サイズが大きくて～
179.definition: But all of the ones on sale are too big.

180.speaker: KING
180.character: エゾリスママは 冬眠しないから
180.definition: It's important that you keep warm, Mama Red Squirrel,

181.speaker: KING
181.definition: since you don't hibernate. How about thumb covers?

182.speaker: MAMA RS
182.character: あれは ちょっと きついのよね～
182.definition: Sadly, those are a little tight.

183.speaker: KING
183.character: 私が 今 欲しいのはね～
183.definition: The thing I want right now is...

184.speaker: LESSER
184.character: 皆さんの 欲しいものじゃなくて
184.definition: We don't need to know what all of you want.

185.speaker: LESSER
185.character: 笹子さんの欲しいものを 聞き出してください!
185.definition: Please just find out what Miss Sasako wants! Oh, by the way, Miss Sasako. I have something I wanted to ask you.

186.speaker: PANDA MAMA
186.character: もうすぐヤマアラシのコンサートチケットが発売になるの
186.definition: Yama Arashi's concert tickets are going on sale soon.

187.speaker: PANDA MAMA
187.definition: Would you like to go with us, Miss Sasako?

190.speaker: SASAKO
190.character: でも 私アイドルとかあまり知りませんし
190.definition: But I don't know much about idols...

192.speaker: KING
192.character: いくつになってもときめく心を 忘れちゃダメなのよ! 女子は!
192.definition: A woman must never forget how it feels to have a crush, no matter how old she is!

194.speaker: PANDA MAMA
194.definition: I'll be ordering five tickets, then.

195.speaker: KING
195.definition: Then it's settled! It's going to be so much fun!

196.speaker: KING
196.character: 笹子さんは どのメンバーのファンなの?
196.definition: Which member do you like, Miss Sasako?

197.speaker: SASAKO
197.character: いえ よく知らないので
197.definition: Well, I don't know much about them...

199.definition: {\a6}Then I'll tell you all about them.

200.speaker: PANDA MAMA
200.character: あらやだ 笹子さん まだ 何も注文してなかったわね
200.definition: Oh, goodness. You haven't ordered anything yet, Miss Sasako.

201.speaker: MAMA RS
201.character: あら! 気がつかなかったわ
201.definition: Oh my. I didn't even notice.

202.speaker: KING
202.character: ダメよ 遠慮してちゃ

203.speaker: MAMA RS
203.character: 聞きたいのは 注文じゃないんですが…

204.speaker: LESSER
204.character: 聞きたいのは 注文じゃないんですが…
204.definition: I didn't mean her order for here... {\a6}I know.

205.speaker: PANDA MAMA
205.character: 私が初めて デートしたときのことなんだけど
205.definition: So when I was on my first date... Ooh, what, what?

206.speaker: PANDA MAMA
206.character: 彼ったらビッグパフェを頼んだのよ
206.definition: I couldn't believe it. He ordered the big parfait for us.

207.speaker: MAMA RS
207.definition: How cute! More importantly, how'd you two end up dating?

208.speaker: PANDA MAMA
208.character: 恥ずかしいわ そんなこと話すの
208.definition: Oh, that'd be too embarrassing to talk about.

209.speaker: MAMA RS
209.character: 聞きたいわよね 笹子さん
209.definition: We totally want to hear about it, don't we, Miss Sasako? Yes...

210.speaker: KING
210.character: 私はね 初デートのとき…

211.speaker: GUY PENGUIN
211.character: トビウオ 食べ放題ですよ
211.definition: I got you all-you-can-eat flying fish.

212.speaker: KING
212.character: トビウオはないわよね～

214.speaker: MAMA RS
214.character: 基本… 女心が わかってないのよね 男子って
214.definition: Men really don't know what women are thinking.

215.speaker: PANDA MAMA
215.character: ほんと! ねっ 笹子さん
215.definition: So true. Right, Miss Sasako? Pardon me.

216.character: こぶ茶 おかわりお願いします!
216.definition: Could I get another kelp tea, please?

218.speaker: MAMA RS
218.character: やっぱり どんなに すてきな人でも
218.definition: No matter how wonderful a guy may be,

219.speaker: MAMA RS
219.character: 尻尾がかっこよくなくちゃ 嫌なの
219.definition: his tail has to look amazing.

221.speaker: PANDA MAMA
221.definition: Really? So the tail is what's important to red squirrels.

223.speaker: SASAKO
223.character: こぶ茶 おかわりお願いします!
223.definition: Could I get another kelp tea, please? Oh, right away!

224.speaker: LESSER
224.character: 笹子さん こぶ茶 ５杯目です
224.definition: Miss Sasako is on her fifth kelp tea. This plan has failed.

225.speaker: POLAR BEAR
225.character: じゃ また 僕が動いてみるよ
225.definition: Then I'll make the next move.

226.speaker: SASAKO
226.character: シロクマさん さっきから 何やってるんだろう
226.definition: I wonder what Mr. Polar Bear is up to...

227.speaker: SASAKO
227.character: 隠れてるつもりみたいだから 声かけにくい
227.definition: It appears that he's trying to be sneaky, so it'd be difficult to talk to him. Miss Sasako was looking at various things, but didn't buy anything.

228.speaker: POLAR BEAR
228.character: だから 何が好みか わからなかった
228.definition: So I couldn't tell what she liked. I see...

229.speaker: LESSER
229.character: もう 打つ手がないですね…
229.definition: I think we've run out of options here.

230.speaker: HANDA
230.character: 何をあげたらいいんだろう…
230.definition: I wonder what I should give her...

231.speaker: POLAR BEAR
231.definition: Well... Why don't you give her something that you think would be best, Mr. Handa?

232.speaker: HANDA
232.definition: Huh? That's easier said than done...

233.speaker: LADY
233.character: ありがとうございました

235.speaker: SASAKO
235.definition: Are you out shopping? Uh, y-yes.

236.speaker: SASAKO
236.character: そうだ よかったら

238.speaker: SASAKO
238.character: 安かったんで ちょっと買いすぎちゃって
238.definition: They were cheap, so I bought a few too many.

240.speaker: SASAKO
240.character: あ 料理とかされないですか?

241.speaker: HANDA
241.character: いえ これ 男爵ですよね?
241.definition: These are Irish Cobbler potatoes, right?

242.speaker: HANDA
242.character: ホクホクしてるからコロッケにすると いいんですよね
242.definition: They don't get soggy, so they're great for croquettes.

243.speaker: SASAKO
243.character: ですよね あと 粉ふきイモもいいですし
243.definition: Indeed. They're great for floured potatoes, too.

244.definition: Yep! By the way, have you heard of Inka no mezame potatoes?

245.speaker: SASAKO
245.character: はい 甘みがあって 栗みたいな食感の
245.definition: Yes. They're sweet and have atexture like chestnuts.

246.speaker: HANDA
246.character: あれもおいしいですよね

247.speaker: HANDA
247.character: あと キタアカリとか

248.speaker: SASAKO
248.character: 詳しいんですね ジャガイモ
248.definition: Wow, you know a lot about potatoes. Well, I like them...

249.speaker: SASAKO
249.character: 私も好きです ジャガイモ

256.speaker: HANDA
256.character: ジャガイモのお礼と いってはなんですが…
256.definition: As sort of a thanks for the potatoes. Are you sure? It's wrapped up very nicely.

257.speaker: HANDA
257.character: いえ そのお礼ですから…
257.definition: Well, uh... it's for a thank you.

258.speaker: SASAKO
258.character: ありがとうございます

261.speaker: HANDA
261.character: ジャガイモと小石って 似てるよな
261.definition: Potatoes and pebbles are alike. But maybe I shouldn't have given Miss Sasako the pebble I found...

262.speaker: HANDA
262.character: きれいだけど だいぶ クリスマスより早いし…
262.definition: It's pretty, but it's way tooearly for Christmas.

263.speaker: SASAKO
263.definition: Mr. Polar Bear. What is it, Miss Sasako?

264.speaker: SASAKO
264.character: 昨日 偶然 半田さんに会って
264.definition: I ran into Mr. Handa coincidentally yesterday

265.character: これ もらったんですけど…

267.speaker: SASAKO
267.character: すごく かわいい 小物入れなんです
267.definition: It's a very cute, little box to put trinkets in.

268.speaker: SASAKO
268.character: でも 中にこれが入ってて

269.speaker: SASAKO
269.definition: I'm not sure what this pebble is for.

270.speaker: SASAKO
270.character: すごく きれいなんです
270.definition: It's very pretty. Something good may happen if you take really good care of it.

271.speaker: PANDA
271.character: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

272.speaker: PENGUIN
272.character: どうしたの パンダ君

273.speaker: PANDA
273.character: いつもは笹子さんがお楽しみにって言ってくれるでしょう
273.definition: Miss Sasako always says "Enjoy" at the end of this, right? I wonder where she is when she says that?

274.speaker: PENGUIN
274.definition: You don't have to look for her.

275.speaker: PANDA
275.character: じゃ ペンギンさんのトラウマはどこにあるんだろう
275.definition: Then where does your trauma lie, Mr. Penguin?

276.speaker: PENGUIN
276.character: それも探さなくてもいいよ
276.definition: You don't need to look for that, either.

278.speaker: POLAR BEAR
278.character: 来週のしろくまカフェは一筆書きでやらせてください
278.definition: Next week's Polar Bear's Café.... will be drawn with a single brush stroke!

279.speaker: PENGUIN
279.definition: What kind of announcement was that?

281.speaker: PANDA
281.character: 笹子さんどこにいるんだろう
